author: cbs8
title: AlaLandCo, Inc. Grows to Serve Alabama and Four Bordering States, Changes Name to Southeastern Land Group
text:
Southeastern Land Group, Inc.
Launches The Land Show on News Talk Radio Stations Statewide and Deploys Two New Websites
DADEVILLE, Ala. , Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Land Agents, Brokers, Foresters and Accredited Land Consultants with AlaLandCo, Inc., have served land-owners and buyers in the state of Alabama for the past 15 years. They have grown through exceptional service and will now serve Alabama and the four states that border Alabama due to increasing demand for their expertise. To serve all five states including Alabama , Georgia , Florida , Tennessee and Mississippi , AlaLandCo, Inc. changed its name to Southeastern Land Group. The new entity will be known in all five states as Southeastern Land Group. AlaLandCo was not purchased by some big, out-of-state corporation, they're still the same knowledgeable land agents who serve Land owners and buyers in Alabama every day. They are a true Alabama success story.
The Land Experts with Southeastern Land Group continue to build on their momentum by launching a new radio show, "The Land Show with Dave Milton " first aired Saturday, October 3rd at 9:00 AM CDT across a large part of Alabama via three iHeart Radio stations and one BlueWater Broadcasting Station including 105.5 FM WERC in Birmingham , WACV 93.1 in Montgomery , 800 AMM/1230 AM Huntsville/ Decatur and 1520 WLTM AM in Auburn . The show continues to pick up Radio Affiliates across Alabama and will also begin airing Saturday, October 17 th on 104.9 ESPN WSLY in Demopolis / Livingston and 100.7 Alabama 100 in Talladega /Ashland.
The Land Show with Dave Milton is focused on everything to do with rural land issues and land investing, farmland, timberland and enjoying the outdoors.
Dave Milton , Accredited Land Consultant & Host of The Land Show explains how the idea of a radio show got started, "We're excited about our weekly show focusing on land issues in our state. The idea came from one of our customers, Ford Stokes. Ford has purchased several properties from us and he thought it would be a good idea to share our knowledge and better educate hard-working folks right here in Alabama on land issues and sound land investing through a weekly, one-hour radio show. Our goal is to entertain, educate and inform listeners about rural land issues that are important to them."
"The Expert Land Agents and Accredited Land Consultants with Southeastern Land Group are so knowledgeable on every aspect of land buying, listing, marketing, selling, farming, managing, timber planting, & timber harvesting, they are going to help a lot more people successfully invest in Alabama land through The Land Show. We're putting a lot of work into it and having a great time doing it!" details Executive Producer with The Land Show and Southeastern Land Group customer, Ford Stokes.
The multi-segment show addresses many the diverse interests in Alabama Land with a weekly featured guest interview, Farmland Report, Timberland Outlook, Recreation and Wildlife Management Updates, Listener Emails and final thoughts from Dave Milton . "We will talk with a prominent figure regarding land, conservation, agriculture, recreation, wildlife management and other topics in our Featured Guest segment every week. It was great to have Chuck Sykes , Director of Wildlife and Freshwater Fisheries with the Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources and John McMillan , Commissioner of Alabama's Department of Agriculture and Industries as our first two featured guests, we will have influential guests on every show to better inform out listeners, It's their show." Dave Milton volunteered.
Robert King , Land Agent and fifth-generation cattle farmer, and Russ Walters , Land Agent and fourth generation row crop farmer share their extensive and varied farming expertise each week in the show's Farmland Report. " Alabama farmers and land owners needed a show like this, most states in the Midwest have crop reports and farm produce pricing updates, we really didn't have that kind of information and insight available in our state until this show." Shared Robert King. Russ Walters went further, "We want to deliver a great, consistent resource for cattle, row crop and poultry farmers to learn what's going on in the market so they can make informed decisions for their family farm."
The Timber industry is one of the largest industries in the state of Alabama contributing billions to billions to the state economy. Kyle Ingalls , Registered Forester and Land Agent, gives the weekly Timberland Outlook on the show and enjoys contributing to the Show, "Timberland owners will gain great tips each week in buying, selling and managing their Timberland properties, we're going to share the latest information we have on Timber pricing and harvesting & management strategies."
The Land Show Crew is going to have a lot of fun on the show too. George Mann , experienced Wildlife Management Expert and Brandon Harris , accomplished big and small game hunter and wildlife manager, will share great ways to have a great time on your land every week with the Recreation and Wildlife Management Update. Mann describes their segment, "We're approaching our weekly report the way we approach managing our land, in 12 distinct Monthly Land Management strategies. We'll share how to get your property ready for the next hunting season and even great recreational ideas the whole family can enjoy." Harris continues, "We're going to give land owners the knowledge to grow and take big deer, big turkeys and big bass!"
The great fun continues with the "Interesting Alabama" report from the field by Jonathan Goode , Land Broker with Southeastern Land Group. "I'll travel across Alabama to interview awesome people who make our state great," claims Goode.
So there's just about something for every type of land enthusiast on "The Land Show with Dave Milton ". Be sure to tune in to your local News Talk or Talk Radio station at 9:00 AM Saturday Mornings, you'll be glad you did.
Lastly, the company didn't leave a single stone unturned with their educational strategy and launched two websites to keep their customers and prospects informed via their company website, http://www.selandgroup.com , and their new radio show website at http://www.TheLandShow.com . Land-owners and prospective land buyers can browse through the company's 500+ property listings on selandgroup.com and download complimentary, valuable information through their BLOG on both sites.
All Southeastern Land Group Agents are available for contribution, quotation and guest columns for stories regarding Alabama Land issues, Government Budget Talks Regarding our state parks, land recreation, the Forever Wild Fund and Wildlife Management. Contact Ford Stokes at 334-332-8340 or via email at ford@stokesmcnutt.com to schedule time with any Southeastern Land Group Agent.
